scenarioDescription:
The HD 181433 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 181433 is a star with 0.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.79 times its radius. It is located 87.66 light years away from the solar system.

HD 181433 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 181433 system


HD 181433 b

HD 181433 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2009-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 b is 6.360 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 181433 b is 2.400 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 181433 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 181433 c

HD 181433 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2009-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.76 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 c is 203.520 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 181433 c is 14.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 181433 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 181433 d

HD 181433 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2009-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 d is 171.720 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 181433 d is 14.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 181433 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 181433, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 181433 - System With 3 Exoplanets
